responses:
Course Registration or Advising is a process by which a student registers

themselves in courses for the upcoming semester.

responses: Yes, there is a notice regarding advising. You can find it here. Link: NSU-Announcements

patterns: What is the advising phase?
How many phases are there for advising?
What is the difference between phases?
What exactly is the advising stage?
How many steps are there in the advising process?
What are the differences between phases?
responses: Advising is divided into three parts. Each of the part is called the advising phase. Different phases have different characteristics. In the first phase those students can advise who have cleared payment and have done pre-advising, faculty evaluation and not in probation.

patterns: What is the first phase?
Tell me about the first phase.
Describe the first phase.
Enlighten me about the first phase .
What should be done in the first phase.
How the first phase works.
What is the procedure of the first phase?
Give me information about the first phase.
Describe the first phase.
Enlighten me about the first phase .
What has to be done in the first phase.
How the first phase works.
What is the technique of the first phase?
Supply me information about the first phase.
responses: Our Advising system consists of three phases. In the first phase students can take the courses which they pre-advised during the pre advising phase. Only courses taken in the pre-advising phase are visible to the students and they can choose courses among those . Also a schedule is given regarding the advising of the first phase. Students can login to RDS during specific slot and complete their first phase of course registration. Students can both add new courses and also drop them in this phase.

patterns: What is the second phase?
Tell me about the second phase.
Describe the second phase.
Enlighten me about the second phase .
What should be done in the second phase.
How the second phase works.
What is the procedure of the second phase?
Give me information about the second phase.
Describe the second phase.
Enlighten me about the second phase .
What has to be done in the second phase.
How the second phase works.
What is the technique of the second phase?
Supply me information about the second phase.
responses: During the second phase all students can advise if they have solved all the issues with their respective department and Registrar of NSU.  In most cases pre-advising restrictions will be removed. All courses will be visible in the advising panel.

patterns: What is the third phase?
Tell me about the third phase.
Describe the third phase.
Enlighten me about the third phase.
What should be done in the third phase.
How the third phase works.
What is the procedure of the third phase?
Give me information about the third phase.
Describe the third phase.
Enlighten me about the third phase.
What has to be done in the third phase.
How the third phase works.
What is the technique of the third phase?
Supply me information about the third phase.
responses: Third phase is the last phase of course registration. In this phase students are allowed to take new courses also can change sections of an already taken course. However, they are not allowed to drop any courses. If any student wishes to drop any course , they will have to pay first and then they can drop the course under 100% refund policy.

patterns: How to drop a course in the first phase?
What is the procedure to drop a course during the first phase?
What is the procedure for dropping a course in the first phase?
What are the steps for dropping a course during the first phase?
What are the steps for dropping a course in the first phase?
What do I do if I want to drop a course during the first phase?
How do you drop a course in the first step?
What do I do if I want to drop a course during the first phase?
What is the protocol for dropping a course during the first phase?
What do I do if I want to drop a course during the first phase?
responses: If you want to drop a course in the first phase, go to your advising portal. And in the courses menu you will see a RED CROSS (❌) sign. Just click on it once and the course will be dropped.

patterns: How to drop a course in the second phase?
What is the procedure to drop a course during the second phase?

What is the protocol for dropping a course during the second phase?
What do I do if I want to drop a course during the second phase?
responses: This is the same as the first phase course drop procedure. In the advised courses section you will see a RED CROSS (❌) sign. Just click on it once and the course will be dropped.

patterns: How to drop a course in the third phase?
What is the procedure to drop a course during the third phase?
What is the procedure for dropping a course in the third phase?
What are the steps for dropping a course during the third phase?
What are the steps for dropping a course in the third phase?
What do I do if I want to drop a course during the third phase?
How do you drop a course in the third step?
What do I do if I want to drop a course during the third phase?
What is the protocol for dropping a course during the third phase?
What do I do if I want to drop a course during the third phase?
responses: Course drop is strictly prohibited in the third phase. However, If you want to drop a course in the third phase, you will need to pay the course fee.

patterns: What is the difference between first phase and second phase advising?
What am I allowed to do in the first phase and second phase?
What is the distinction between first and second phase advising?
In the first and second phases, what am I allowed to do?
responses: First phase advising is based on students pre-advising selection. Students can add, drop and section change. Every student will have two slots for the day. Students who missed a slot have the option to advise in phase 2 in phase 3. And in the second phase no slot will be provided. It is open to all students but the system enters a queue system if the student number exceeds a limit. Pre-advising restrictions will be removed. All courses will be visible in the advising panel. Students can add, drop and section change.

patterns: What is the difference between second phase and third phase advising?
What am I allowed to do in the second phase and third phase?
What is the distinction between second and third phase advising?
In the second and third phases, what am I allowed to do?
responses: In the second phase, no slot will be provided. It is open to all students but the system entry is queue controlled if the student number exceeds a limit. Pre-advising restrictions will be removed. All courses will be visible in the advising panel. Students can add, drop and section change. But in the third phase, the system will remain open for advising for all students. Course drop is strictly prohibited. Section change is allowed

patterns: What is the difference between first phase and third phase advising?
What am I allowed to do in the first phase and third phase?
What is the distinction between first and third phase advising?
In the first and third phases, what am I allowed to do?
responses: In the first phase, advising will be based on students pre-advising selection. Students can add, drop and section change. Every student will have two slots for the day. But in the third phase, the system will remain open for advising for all students. Course drop is strictly prohibited. Section change is allowed

patterns: Whom to contact for first phase advising?
I can not advise during the first phase advising, who do I have to contact?
Give me contact information for the first phase advising problem.
I have problems in first phase advising. Who should I contact for first phase advising?
Who do I need to call if I am unable to advise during the first phase of advising?
Please provide me with contact details for the first phase of the advising process.
In the first phase of advising, I'm having difficulties.
responses: Firstly please be sure that you meet the following requirements. You are not missing pre-advising, your payment is not due. Your faculty evaluation is complete. And you have not missed advising for more than two consecutive semesters. If all these are okay, then you can send an email to: helpdesk@northsouth.edu Or you can also call IT Helpdesk- +880-2-55668200 and use the extension number 1400 when asked.

patterns: Whom to contact for second phase advising?

Who do I need to call if I am unable to advise during the second phase of advising?
Please provide me with contact details for the second phase of the advising process.
In the second phase of advising, I'm having difficulties.
responses: Send an email describing your issues with screenshots if available to: helpdesk@northsouth.edu Or you can also call IT Helpdesk- +880-2-55668200 and use the extension number 1400 when asked. And describe the issue to them, they will help you.

patterns: I cannot drop a course.
I am having issues with dropping a course.
My course is not dropping.
Why is a course not dropping?
How to drop a course.
What is the procedure to drop a course?
How can I drop a course?
responses: If you are in the third phase of advising you will not be able to drop a course. To be able to do that you need to pay for the registered course. Even after this you are not being able to drop a course, take a screenshot of that and email it to (helpdesk@northsouth.edu) or you can call IT Helpdesk- +880-2-55668200 and use the extension number 1400 when asked.

patterns: My section was cancelled, what can I do?
Why is my section cancelled.
What to do if my section is cancelled.
What is the reason for my section cancellation .
I took a section but the section is cancelled,what is the reason?
responses:
First talk to the department and check whether the section is cancelled or not . If there are further issues, please contact the Department Secretary or Program Officer of your respective department.
A section might be cancelled because of the following reasons, less number of students registered in the section. Two sections were merged due to less number of students. Department has decided not to offer that course section anymore.

patterns: How can I get faculty initials?
How to get faculty initial of a course?
What is the procedure to get faculty initials?
where can i see my faculty initials?
responses: Faculty initial will be revealed when the department will release them. In most cases you will know your faculty initials for that course just before first class on your RDS or advising slip.

patterns: Course not found in advising menu.
I pre advised but did not find my course in advising menu.
Course missing in the advising menu.
Advising menu course not showing.
The course I'm looking for isn't mentioned in the advising menu.
I pre-advised, but my course was not included in the advising menu.
The advising menu is not showing my course.
responses: Make sure you have done pre-advising properly. There are lots of mistakes that can be made by you. For example: you thought you had pre advised CSE499 but you actually did CEE499. There can be many other issues, some of you might have not saved your pre advised courses properly. Please make sure you did that properly. For further contact email (helpdesk@northsouth.edu) or you can call IT Helpdesk- +880-2-55668200 and use the extension number 1400 when asked.

patterns: ID not showing in advising list.
ID not found in phase one.
ID does not appear in the advising list.
In phase one, my ID was not included.
responses: There are many reasons for ID not found problems. You have to clear your previous dues, complete your pre-advising and faculty evaluation and make sure your ID is not blocked for other reasons by asking the registrar office.

patterns: My ID is not found in the advising list , whom to contact?
Who can I contact for my ID missing in advising?
Who can I contact if my ID isn't included in the advising list?
Who can I contact if my ID is absent from the advising?
responses: Talk to the department if everything is okay, then please contact the registrar office.

patterns: Where can I find the offered course list?
Where to find the offered course list?
Where can I get the advising course list?
responses: First find the advising notice and go to the link given there for the course offer list. Link: Offered courses

patterns: Can I advise in the first phase?
Who can advise in the first phase?
Who is eligible to take the course in the first phase?
responses: Students who are listed on the advising list can advise in the first phase.

patterns: Can I advise in the second phase?
Who can advise in the second phase?
Who is eligible to take the course in the second phase?
responses: If all of your dues are cleared, not in probation and also unblocked your ID (If id is blocked) then you can advise in the second phase.

patterns: How can I drop courses with refunds?
How to drop a course with a refund?
I need to drop the course with a refund.
responses: Please check the last day of your course drop with a refund from Academic Calendar. According to the advising guideline, you have to pay first, then go to your RDS and you have to drop the course before that day.

patterns: My payment status does not show refund.
I had refunds available, it is not showing in the payment slip.
responses: In most of the cases, it is updated within a few days. But if you need it urgently, please contact or go to the Accounts Department and adjust the refund. If it is cleared from the accounts you will be able to pay after that. Even after that the problem is not solved, contact (helpdesk@northsouth.edu) or you can call IT Helpdesk- +880-2-55668200 and use the extension number 1400 when asked.

patterns: tell me about yourself
what is your goal
what do you do
responses: My task is to help you clear your confusions or give you the possible replies within my resources
